item.title: Sharon add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sharon add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "If I'm out of my mind, it's all right with me, thought Moses Herzog." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Randall Jarell
item.description: "A poet is a man who manages, in a lifetime of standing out in thunderstorms, to be struck by lightning five or six times." -- Randall Jarell

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Karen Joy Fowler
item.description: "I once broke up with a boy because he wrote me an awful poem." -- Karen Joy Fowler

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Li-Young Lee
item.description: "I am that last, that final thing, the body in a white sheet listening," -- Li-Young Lee

item.title: Sharon add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "I live not in myself, but I become Portion of that around me: and to me High mountains are a feeling, but the hum of human cities torture." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Paul Valery
item.description: "Poems are never finished - just abandoned" -- Paul Valery

item.title: Sharon add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Joel Carmichael
item.description: "Art is bad when ‘you see the intent and get put off.’ (Goethe) In Tolstoy one is unaware of the intent, and sees only the thing itself. from the book, On Retranslating A Russian Classic Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy" -- Joel Carmichael

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "The role of the artist is to ask questions, not answer them." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Maxine Hong Kingston
item.description: "In a time of destruction, create something." -- Maxine Hong Kingston

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Antonio Porchia
item.description: "One lives in the hope of becoming a memory." -- Antonio Porchia

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Jessamyn West
item.description: "Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures." -- Jessamyn West

item.title: Sharon add a quote by A.J. RUSSELL
item.description: "All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance." -- A.J. RUSSELL

item.title: Sharon add a quote by William Pickens
item.description: "To cheapen the lives of any group of men, cheapens the lives of all men, even our own. This is a law of human psychology, or human nature. And it will not be repealed by our wishes, nor will it be merciful to our blindness." -- William Pickens

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Amanda Cross
item.description: "A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar." -- Amanda Cross

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "Indeed, learning to write may be part of learning to read. For all I know, writing comes out of a superior devotion to reading." -- Eudora Welty
